file_insights.changes: Added import for GanttDemoPage component and registered new route

patterns_discovered.pattern: Page component imports and route registration
patterns_discovered.description: Consistent pattern of importing page components and registering them in the routing configuration within a protected route wrapper
New routes are added as children of a parent Route that enforces authentication via ProtectedRoute component
patterns_discovered.evidence: GanttDemoPage route placed within the existing Route structure alongside other pages like ApprovalsPage and AuditLogPage

patterns_discovered.description: Page components follow PascalCase naming with 'Page' suffix (e.g., GanttDemoPage, AuditLogPage, RFIPage)
patterns_discovered.evidence: All page imports follow the pattern of [Name]Page

gotchas_discovered.description: New routes must be added within the correct nested Route element to ensure they are protected by authentication
gotchas_discovered.note: Route placement is critical - adding outside the parent Route would bypass authentication

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully added Gantt demo route to the application routing configuration
approach_outcome.execution: Direct route and import addition completed in single attempt
approach_outcome.notes: Task was straightforward - required only import statement and route registration following existing patterns

recommendations.recommendation: Consider creating a routing configuration file to centralize route definitions and reduce coupling in App.tsx
recommendations.rationale: As routes accumulate, App.tsx may become harder to maintain

recommendations.recommendation: Ensure GanttDemoPage component exists in pages directory before deployment
recommendations.rationale: Current change assumes the page component has been created; import will fail if component is missing
